experiments.description: An object to record all active experiments, experiments IDs are stored as keys, and the value object stores the branch information. Example: {"experiment_1": {"branch": "control"}, "experiment_2": {"branch": "treatment"}}. This deprecates the "shield_id" used in activity-stream and messaging-system.

highlights_data_late_by_ms.description: Latency of the data availability for Highlights

is_preloaded.description: Whether or not this session is preloaded

load_trigger_ts.description: To store the timestamp (ms since Unix epoch) when this session gets triggered

topsites_data_late_by_ms.description: Latency of the data availability for Top Sites

topsites_first_painted_ts.description: To store the timestamp (ms since Unix epoch) when the Top Sites is first painted

topsites_icon_stats.description: Icon stats for Top Sites, only sent if Top Sites is enabled

topsites_pinned.description: The total number of pinned Top Sites in this session

topsites_search_shortcuts.description: The total number of search shortcuts in this session

visibility_event_rcvd_ts.description: To store the timestamp (ms since Unix epoch) when the page is made visible to the user in this session

profile_creation_date.description: Profile age in days since Unix epoch

session_duration.description: The duration of this session in milliseconds. The session begins at `perf.visibility_event_rcvd_ts` and ends when the page is navigated away

session_id.description: A UUID representing an Activity Stream session. This can be used to do table joins between `sessions` and `events` in Activity Stream. Note that `n/a` denotes that the session is not applicable in the context.

shield_id.description: [DEPRECATED]: use `experiments` instead. A semicolon separated string to store a list of Shield study IDs

user_prefs.description: An encoded integer representing user's preferences of Activity Stream

additional_properties.description: A JSON string containing any payload properties not present in the schema

document_id.description: The document ID specified in the URI when the client sent this message

geo.description: Results of a geographic lookup based on the client's IP address

db_version.description: The specific geo database version used for this lookup

subdivision1.description: First major country subdivision, typically a state, province, or county

subdivision2.description: Second major country subdivision; not applicable for most countries

header.description: Headers included in the client's HTTP request

isp.description: Results of ISP lookup based on the client's IP address

db_version.description: The specific geo ISP database version used for this lookup

name.description: The name of the ISP associated with the client's IP address

organization.description: The name of a specific business entity associated with the client's IP address when available; otherwise the ISP name

user_agent.description: Parsed components of the client's user agent string

normalized_app_name.description: Set to "Other" if this message contained an unrecognized app name

normalized_channel.description: Set to "Other" if this message contained an unrecognized channel name

normalized_os.description: Set to "Other" if this message contained an unrecognized OS name

sample_id.description: Hashed version of client_id (if present) useful for partitioning; ranges from 0 to 99

submission_timestamp.description: Time when the ingestion edge server accepted this message
